definition: to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of

sentences.english: We really liked each other and we hit it off, you know?
sentences.chinese: 我们正好很投缘，所以演得很顺，你知道吗？

sentences.english: Weve hit it off ever since we knew each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们从刚认识就很投缘。

sentences.english: After that, they found that they were very compatible and begun dating.
sentences.chinese: 从那之后，两人便十分投缘，进而开始交往。

sentences.english: Justin and Lisa get along really well. But what about Tom?
sentences.chinese: 贾斯汀和莉萨很投缘，但汤姆怎么办？

sentences.english: How can you ever be done talking with such a good friend?
sentences.chinese: 和投缘的朋友一聊开，什么时候才有停？

sentences.english: In this context having a relationship with the mentor that is productive and congenial is very important.
sentences.chinese: 从这方面讲，跟一个高产的并且投缘的导师非常重要。

sentences.english: In love, although they are fit to the opposite sex, but are also easily involved in romantic affairs.
sentences.chinese: 爱情方面，虽与异性投缘，但容易惹上桃色新闻。

sentences.english: I found quite a few classmates congenial to me.
sentences.chinese: 我发现班里有几个同学和我挺投缘。

sentences.english: He wanders the seaport and meets a fisherman, Long Hai.
sentences.chinese: 世贤在海港巧遇渔船船长龙海，二人投缘。

sentences.english: I found you congenial to me.
Sounds like you chatted with each other very congenially.
sentences.chinese: 听起来你们两个聊得非常投缘啊。

definition: to get along well (with sb)/congenial/to speculate (on financial markets)
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
to get along well/compatible/also written 和得來|和得来[he2 de5 lai2]
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
to share vile habits/partners in notoriety/birds of a feather
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
